description:
Overview

The Business Development Manager will handle everything for a customer including sales, customer service, and the execution of the load on a third-party carrier. This position will accomplish this by actively prospecting, soliciting, and building relationships with both new customers and carriers on behalf of Covenant Logistics to ensure we are focused on diversifying our customer base. The Business Development Manager will also be tasked with leading Account Managers to ensure they are fully trained on our sales and operational processes, and to cultivate new business relationships with prospective customers.

Responsibilities

• Routinely identify and qualify new business opportunities to position our Enterprise and execute our service offering.• Generate new business through prospecting, networking, cold calls, and referrals by building a portfolio of customers in geographic areas outside of current customer base.• Utilize ZoomInfo to source, identify prospects, develop customer opportunities, and log ongoing communication.• Maintain current company, contact, and opportunity info in Salesforce.• Communicate regularly with internal stakeholders to ensure new business can be onboarded at a high-level.• Enter load information into the system along with scheduling pickups and deliveries.• Manage team members to achieve desired results related to revenue goals.• Solicit and find carriers to operate the business that is sold.• Track the freight to ensure on-time pickups and deliveries occur.• Communicate regularly with customers to provide ETA’s and updates on all loads.• Conduct ongoing follow up to develop greater value, communicate new opportunities, and build professional relationships.• Oversee Account Managers to ensure they are meeting customer needs.• Ensure routine review of performance scorecards with customers.• Work with Operations teams to understand network capabilities and needs.• Meet or exceed goals for sales revenue and gross margin on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis.

Qualifications

Knowledge Skills, and Abilities• Proficiency in Tech Systems – Office, Outlook, TMS, etc.• Effective Written and Verbal Communication Skills.• Business Management Skills – Detail Oriented, Organized, Time Management.• High Level of Initiative, Competitive, Action Oriented, Problem Solver.• Fast-paced and able to multitask in a high-pressure environment.• Strong negotiation skills.• Ability to take instruction and execute with confidence.Education and Experience• Bachelor’s Degree focused in Business, Supply Chain, Logistics or Finance preferred. • Minimum of 1 year experience in Transportation/Logistics/Supply Industry Experience required.

Competitive Compensation

Covenant’s compensation philosophy’s intent is to use a competitive total compensation strategy to determine the current market value of a position while also considering individual factors such as performance in current position, time in seat of current position, experience, level of responsibility/accountability, and longevity with the company.
